entry.title: The Bazaar
entry.content:
So I’m at The Bazaar in New York City and there’s a lot of talk about SourceForge. Emmett Plant has written a story about it over at Linux Today.

Thanks Emmett.

entry.title: I don’t think we’re in Kansas anymore ToTo..
entry.content:
VA went public today….stock went out the door at $320.00 a share (or so). Closed out the day at $239.00 a share. Biggest IPO of the year.

Wow…I’m stunned. Absolutely stunned…as well as half drunk.

entry.title: SourceForge Launched
entry.content:
So what was once “Cold Storage” is now SourceForge and is now available for public consumption. So what is SourceForge? Well it’s a web resource for Open Source projects and organizations. We’re providing CVS, mailing lists, public forums, the ability to poll visitors and project members, bug tracking and anonymous FTP for all open source projects to anyone completely free of charge.

I encourage anyone that’s involved in an open source project to stop by and try it out.

Big thanks go out to Larry Augustin, Tim Perdue, Drew Streib, and Uriah Welcome for making this happen.

entry.title: ColdStorage
entry.content: After a few days here at VA I’m going to end up working on the ColdStorage Project. I can’t really go into too much detail as to what it is and what we’re trying to accomplish but we’ll be launching sometime this year.

entry.title: First Day
entry.content: Today was my first day at VA Research. It was exciting and the company appears to be focused and there’s alot of energy in the office. I’m employee #31 and Carsten “Rasterman” Haitzler also started today.
